Title: Dropout: A Simple Way to Prevent Neural Networks from Overfitting
Comment: Dropout introduction.

Title: Multi-Scale Context Intertwining for Semantic Segmentation
Comment: An approach to use multi scale scene understanding in order to enhance segmentation results. The multiscale merging is bidirectional from higher res to lower res and from lower res to higher res thanks to LSTM cells.

Title: Efficient Inference in Fully Connected CRFs with Gaussian Edge Potentials
Comment: Dense CRF (base to CRFasRNN), how to enhance deep learning networks results with conditional random fields.

Title: Explaining and Harnessing Adversarial Examples
Comment: Adversarial examples explanations and harnessing methodology.

Title: FaceNet: A Unified Embedding for Face Recognition and Clustering
Comment: Transforms an image into an Euclidean space where distances directly correspond to a measure of face similarity which in turn enhance face recognition results. Introduction of harmonic embedding and triplet-loss.

Title: Cyclical Learning Rates for Training Neural Networks
Comment: A new approach to the learning rate hyperparameter tuning named cyclical learning rates. This learning rate policy varies the learning rate between reasonable boundary values.

Title: G-CNN: an Iterative Grid Based Object Detector
Comment: A faster than Fast R-CNN object detection algorithm with still a taste of recursivity.

Title: From Softmax to Sparsemax: A Sparse Model of Attention and Multi-Label Classification
Comment: Sparcemax activiation function and smooth and convex loss introduction.

Title: Superpixels: An Evaluation of the State-of-the-Art
Comment: An index to all super pixels methods in the wild.

Title: Towards principles methods for training generative advesarial networks
Comment: Make theoretical steps toward the understanding of the training dynamics of generative adversarial networks.

Title: What Uncertainties Do We Need in Bayesian Deep Learning for Computer Vision?
Comment: Epistemic and aleatoric uncertainty definition for computer vision task in deep learning.

Title: Semi and Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation Using Generative Adversarial Network
Comment: Combining labelled data with numerous unlabelled or weakly labelled data and fake GAN images to enhance segmentation results.

Title: Snapshot Ensemble: train 1, get M for free
Comment: Optimizing training time using several models to get the final results: cycling learning rate strategy followed gives m local minimas, each of them is a model, the final result is an average ensembling of the m models. Simple yet effective inference enhancement.

Title: Multi-Task Learning Using Uncertainty to Weigh Losses for Scene Geometry and Semantics
Comment: Learning of weights in mutli tasks networks here for segmentation and instance segmentation.

Title: MMGAN: Manifold-Matching Generative Adversarial Network
Comment: Introduction of new GAN architecture to overcome the discriminator not depending on ground truth issue.

Title: Focal Loss for Dense Object Detection
Comment: The introduced Focal Loss focuses training on a sparse set of hard examples and prevents the vast number of easy negatives from overwhelming the detector during training.

Title: Multi-Task Learning for Segmentation of Building Footprints with Deep Neural Networks
Comment: Introducing Distance transform prediction in a multi task architecture to improve object segmentation boundaries.

Title: Testing with Concept Activation Vectors (TCAV)
Comment: An attempt to explain deep learning networks with concepts much like a Human would do

Title: Context Encoding for Semantic Segmentation
Comment: EncNet: introducing the context encoding module in order to give a general sense to a scene, narrowing the probability of each class.

Title: Efficient Interactive Annotation of Segmentation Datasets with Polygon-RNN++
Comment: Speedup annotation process with a human in the loop. The live demo is fun to play with: http://www.cs.toronto.edu/~amlan/demo/

Title: Adaptive Affinity Fields for Semantic Segmentation
Comment: Adaptive Affinity Fields (AAF) to capture and match the semantic relations between neighbouring pixels in the label space. Similar to CRF without the computing cost.

Title: ExFuse: Enhancing Feature Fusion for Semantic Segmentation
Comment: ExFuse: new approach to merge low-level and high-level features.

Title: Auxiliary Tasks in Multi-task Learning
Comment: Extended vision of EncNet, introducing multi auxiliary task from minor interest to irrelevant in order to boost performances and main tasks.

Title: Pyramid Attention Network for Semantic Segmentation
Comment: Next generation of PSP, ASPP.

Title: Neural Ordinary Differential Equations
Comment: Explorative new family of neural network that ``parameterizes the derivative of the hidden state using a neural network''.

Title: Relational inductive biases, deep learning, and graph networks
Comment: Advocacy for combinatory between ``hand-engineering'' and ``end-to-en'' learning in order to overcome current full deep learning approachs.

Title: DGC-Net: Dense Geometric Correspondence Network
Comment: Dense and subpixel correspondence.

Title: IBM Machine Learning Maturity model
Comment: Presents a set of best practices to implement when a company wants to deploy machine learning at scale and in a friendly fashion with enterprise landscape. Many of them might be complicated to achieve, anyhow, it will highlight any shortcomings in your projects or potential area of focus.

Title: Grasp2Vec: Learning Object Representations from Self-Supervised Grasping
Comment: Embedding used in reinforcement learning to represent reality through physcial world robot grasping.

Title: Learned Video Compression
Comment: A traditional codec architecture where elements are replaced by Machine Learning ones. Results: the new codec outperforms all existing video codecs.

Title: Robust Website Fingerprinting Through the Cache Occupancy Channel
Comment: What if you can leverage machine learning and a Javascript security hole to track anyone browsing history?

Title: GAN Dissection: Visualizing and Understanding Generative Adversarial networks
Comment: GAN examined under a microscope, a major leap forward into GANs comprehension.

Title: A Style-Based Generator Architecture for Generative Adversarial networks
Comment: Here we are, on December 2018 we discovered than a computer can generate images that we can definitely take for real ones. Style transfer has been used.

Title: Learning to Design RNA
Comment: Reinforcement Learning used to design RNA sequence testing

Title: Panoptic Feature Pyramid Networks
Comment: Unified architecture for multi task segmentation and instance segmentation.

Title: Auto-DeepLab: Hierarchical Neural Architecture Search for Semantic Image Segmentation
Comment: The next DeepLab generation which was already the state of the art in this field.

Title: FishNet: A Versatile Backbone for Image, Region, and Pixel Level Prediction
Comment: FishNet, a fish shaped network that preserved information of all resolutions and refined it for the final task.

Title: High-Fidelity Image Generation With Fewer Labels
Comment: How pre-training a network with "simple" rotations helps to learn features even without labeled data. The network achieve state of the art performances with 10% of the label.

Title: Fast Interactive Object Annotation with Curve-GCN
Comment: Graph Convolutional Network (GCN) leveraged to speedup manual objects annotation. Trained on Cityscape, yet generalized on other data types such as Aerial or Medicine.

Title: Semantic Image Synthesis with Spatially-Adaptive Normalization
Comment: The input mask is used all along the network to maintain spatial structure.

Title: Four Experiments in Handwriting with a Neural Network
Comment: Interactive exeperiments to understand network based on your handwriting inputs.

Title: Using Artificial Intelligence to Augment Human Intelligence
Comment: Let a human play with internal representation of a model provides new tools for reasoning.

Title: The Building Blocks of Interpretability
Comment: Combining various interpretability techniques to better understand networks

Title: Deep Multi-Class Segmentation Without Ground-Truth Labels
Comment: Training a segmentation algorithm without ground truth thanks to adversarial network.

Title: Improved Deep Metric Learning with Multi-class N-pair Loss Objective
Comment: Multi-class N-pair loss.

Title: AROSICS: An Automated and Robust Open-Source Image Co-Registration Software for Multi-Sensor Satellite Data
Comment: An extensive description of an Open-Source python program for co-registration: automatic detection and correction of sub-pixel misalignments between various remote sensing datasets
